page.title: 10Branton Village
page.content:
The small village of Branton lies about three quarters of a mile from the larger village of Powburn which is the largest centre of population in our area. It has sixteen houses but three of these are now used as holiday homes.It also has a school which, at present, has 28 children from the ages of four to nine years.
In times gone by Branton also had a shop and a church but the church is now an antique shop (which is only open at weekends) and the shop stopped trading several years ago. Going back further still in time, Branton used to have a pub, situated in part of what is now the pottery.
Sadly, Branton now has no shops or facilities for community meetings with the exception of the school.
